revised_title: An Investigation into the Force of Percussion and the Role of Cohesion in Soft Bodies
tldr: The author conducts a series of experiments to determine the relationship between the force of percussion and the velocity of striking bodies. He finds that the impressions made in soft bodies are proportional to the square of the velocity, while the impressions in pulverized clay and brick-dust are closer to being proportional to the velocity itself. The author suggests that this difference is due to the degree of cohesion in the soft bodies.
